exercise: Create a vector named 'ages' that contains the ages of 5 different people: 25, 30, 35, 40, 45. Print the vector to check your result.
hint: Remember to use the 'c()' function to combine elements into a vector.

exercise:
Create a data frame named 'students' with two columns: 'name' and 'grade'. Fill in the data frame with the following values:

| name   | grade |
|--------|-------|
| Alice  | 85    |
| Bob    | 92    |
| Claire | 78    |
| David  | 88    |

Print the data frame to check your result.
hint: Use the 'data.frame()' function to create the data frame and specify the column names and values.
solution:
name <- c('Alice', 'Bob', 'Claire', 'David')
grade <- c(85, 92, 78, 88)
students <- data.frame(name, grade)
print(students)
